com.csharp.sharedclasses.fontyspublisher

Class Publisher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.csharp.sharedclasses.fontyspublisher.Publisher

  • public class Publisher
extends java.lang.Object
    Publisher. Properties may be registered and unregistered by the domain. Local as well as remote property listeners may subscribe to one or more registered properties. In case a property changes in the domain, the domain should invoke method inform() with the appropriate property. All listeners subscribed to that property will be informed through a (remote) method invocation of propertyChange(). Listeners subscribed to the null-String are by definition subscribed to all properties. Note that (remote) method invocation of propertyChange() is done asynchronously.

    • Method Detail

      • subscribeLocalListener

        public void subscribeLocalListener(ILocalPropertyListener listener,
                                   java.lang.String property)
        Subscribe local property listener. Local listener will be subscribed to given property. In case given property is the null-String, the listener will be subscribed to all properties.
        Parameters:
        listener - local property listener to be subscribed
        property - null-String allowed

      • subscribeRemoteListener

        public void subscribeRemoteListener(IRemotePropertyListener listener,
                                    java.lang.String property)
        Subscribe remote property listener. Remote listener will be subscribed to given property. In case given property is the null-String, the listener will be subscribed to all properties.
        Parameters:
        listener - remote property listener to be subscribed
        property - null-String allowed

      • unsubscribeLocalListener

        public void unsubscribeLocalListener(ILocalPropertyListener listener,
                                     java.lang.String property)
        Unsubscribe local property listener. Listener will be unsubscribed from given property. In case given property is the null-string, the listener will be unsubscribed from all properties.
        Parameters:
        listener - local property listener to be unsubscribed
        property - null-String allowed

      • unsubscribeRemoteListener

        public void unsubscribeRemoteListener(IRemotePropertyListener listener,
                                      java.lang.String property)
        Unsubscribe remote property listener. Listener will be unsubscribed from given property. In case given property is the null-string, the listener will be unsubscribed from all properties.
        Parameters:
        listener - remote property listener to be unsubscribed
        property - null-String allowed

      • inform

        public void inform(java.lang.String property,
                   java.lang.Object oldValue,
                   java.lang.Object newValue)
        Inform all listeners subscribed to property. All listeners subscribed to given property as well as all listeners subscribed to null-String are informed of a change of given property through a (remote) method invocation of propertyChange(). In case given property is the null-String all subscribed listeners are informed.
        Parameters:
        property - property is either null-String or is registered
        oldValue - original value of property at domain (null is allowed)
        newValue - new value of property at domain

      • registerProperty

        public void registerProperty(java.lang.String property)
        Register property. Register property at this publisher. From now on listeners can subscribe to this property. Nothing changes in case given property was already registered.
        Parameters:
        property - empty string not allowed

      • unregisterProperty

        public void unregisterProperty(java.lang.String property)
        Unregister property. Unregister property at this publisher. From now on listeners subscribed to this property will not be informed on changes. In case given property is null-String, all properties (except null) will be unregistered.
        Parameters:
        property - registered property at this publisher

      • getProperties

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getProperties()
        Obtain all registered properties. An unmodifiable list all properties including the null property is returned.
        Returns:
        list of registered properties including null
